text: Julius Hulburt (November 4, 1805 – ? ), was a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly. He in was born in New York. He married Sarah M. Vosburg. Both of them Baptists, they had four children and settled in what is now Green County, Wisconsin. Hulburt died on October 19, 1881. One of Julius and Sarah's children, Chauncey, owned what is now known as the C.D. Hulburt House, listed on the National Register of Historic Places. ==Career== Hulburt was a member of the Assembly from 1850 to 1851. He was a member of the Whig Party. ==References== ==See also== * Category:Baptists from Wisconsin Category:19th- century American politicians Category:Baptists from New York (state) Category:People from Green County, Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:Wisconsin Whigs Category:1805 births Category:1881 deaths Category:Burials in Wisconsin
title: Julius Hulburt
